title: A coup for football's A-League - 06-Sep-2024 - NZ Soccer news
text: News | Soccer 6 Sep 2024 9:04 | outlook hotmail | yahoo mail | gmail | news | weather | finance | shopping | about nzcity | Search | NZCity News SEARCH Google Bing NZ News NewsLinks the White Pages NZ Street Names the Yellow Pages Yahoo NZ Web sites SearchNZ NZ Domain Names CUSTOMISE Start Page Personalise News Top Stories Business Sports Politics Health & Safety Law and Order Technology Education Living & Travel Entertainment Motoring Environment National International Accidents Maori Rural Local Politics Sport Weather Finance Shopping Jobs Horoscopes Lotto Results Photo Gallery Site Gallery TVNow Dating SearchNZ NZSearch Crime.co.nz RugbyLeague Make Home About NZCity Contact NZCity Your Privacy Advertising Login Join for Free Home > News > Sports > Soccer A coup for football's A-League A coup for football's A-League 6 September 2024 Spanish midfielder Juan Mata has signed for the Western Sydney Wanderers. The 36-year-old won the Champions League and FA Cup at Chelsea - along with four trophies during an eight-year spell at Manchester United. >> More Soccer News © 2024 Newstalk ZB, NZCity Other Soccer News 05 Sep: A wait-and-see approach in All Whites camp as to how the new Kiwi rivalry plays out in football's A-League 05 Sep: A belief that the large number of All Whites joining Auckland FC will help them be a competitive force in their first season in football's A-League 03 Sep: A tough opening match for the New Zealand side at football's under-20 women's World Cup in Colombia 03 Sep: Another New Zealand footballer has signed for Auckland FC 02 Sep: The Wellington Phoenix have secured another import from Japan 02 Sep: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag's suggested his side were sluggish after a 3-nil home Premier League football loss to Liverpool 01 Sep: Striker Erling Haaland's scored his second straight hat-trick to help Manchester City beat West Ham 3-1 in the English Premier League Top Stories RUGBY Confidence that Wallace Sititi has what it takes in a crucial rematch with the All Blacks oldest foe More... BUSINESS Two high-end clothing stores in Wellington are calling it quits More... Today's News Hamilton: One person's died and another's in a serious condition in hospital, after a two-vehicle crash south of Hamilton 8:57 Entertainment: Holland Taylor and Sarah Paulson think about people "in the same way" 8:38 Politics: Health New Zealand says it's amended a scheme for young people in Hawke's Bay, to ensure financial sustainability 8:37 Sailing: Team New Zealand have negotiated tricky sailing conditions off the coast of Barcelona for another two wins in the America's Cup challenger series 8:17 Entertainment: Taylor Swift features prominently in a new NFL commercial 8:08 Politics: A last minute amendment to NZ’s gang legislation risks making a bad law worse 8:07 Law and Order: Police are expected to provide more information today about an incident in Grey Lynn 8:07 International: Gregor Johann Haas could be sent to Indonesia after accused Chinese spy Alice Guo sent to the Philippines 7:57 Entertainment: Kristin Cavallari's 12-year-old son "wants to be on social media" 7:38 Law and Order: Police are continuing to appeal for sightings of a 67-year-old Australian tourist, missing in the Tongariro area 7:37 News Search Soccer NZ News NewsLinks NZ Web Power Search © 2024 New Zealand City Ltd
